raw_comment:
1) In general, applicants whose parents' income percentile rank is 90 or above have a significantly greater chance (up to 7 times more likely) to get accepted at an elite college. Legacy applicants are more likely to get accepted than non-legacy applicants in every income bracket.

2) I wonder why legacy boosts still exist. Why is status and income favored over ability?  

3) Many people are led to believe that college is synonymous with success. They put a lot of time and effort to meet the criterion for attending these elite schools. Yet because of their income and status, they are not even considered. Thus, the wealth inequality becomes even greater. 
 
4) The Legacy Continues, The Gap Widens
